00031 #include <cppconn/driver.h>
00032 #include <cppconn/prepared_statement.h>
00033 #include <cppconn/exception.h>

00035 #include "pci_class_ids.hpp"

00037 using std::string;

00043 static void throw_call_garbage(sql::Statement*);

00047 
00048 int PciIdsClass::store_db (void)
00049 {
00050   std::vector<PciIdsSubclass*>::iterator iter_sub;
00051   std::vector<PciIdsProgif*>::iterator iter_prog;
00052 
00053   PciIdsSubclass* tmp_sub;
00054   PciIdsProgif* tmp_prog;
00055 
00056   const string host_url("localhost"); // Where MySQL Server is located.
00057   const string user("root");          // User to connect to the server.
00058   const string pass("password");      // Password of the user.
00059   const string database("harix_db");  // Database to connect to.
00060 
00061   // Hold names and codes of the Pci IDs class entries.
00062   string class_code, class_name, subclass_code, subclass_name, prog_code, prog_name;
00063 
00064   // Could be better with MySQL Prepared Statement
00065   // but it's buggy operating with Stored Procedures at the moment
00066   
00067   try{
00068 
00069     /*
00070      * Connect to Database with MySQL Connector/C++
00071      * @{
00072      */
00073     sql::Driver* driver = get_driver_instance();
00074     std::auto_ptr<sql::Connection> connector( driver->connect(host_url, user, pass) );
00075     connector->setSchema(database);
00076     std::auto_ptr<sql::Statement> stmt(connector->createStatement());
00077     /*
00078      * @}
00079      */
00080 
00081     class_code = "\"" + get_code() + "\"" ;     // Get code of current Pci IDs class object.
00082     class_name = "\"" + get_name() + "\"";      // Get name of current Pci IDs class object.
00083 
00084     // Call the stored procedure to add or update the given class.  
00085     stmt->execute("CALL sp_pciClassesAdd("+ class_code + "," + class_name + ")");
00086 
00087     // Empty the retrieved result set, so we don't have problems with next statement.   
00088     throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00089 
00090 
00091     // Iterate through Subclass list of the Class
00092     for( iter_sub = kid_list.begin(); iter_sub != kid_list.end(); ++iter_sub ){
00093       
00094       tmp_sub = *iter_sub;
00095       subclass_code = "\"" + tmp_sub->get_code() + "\"" ;   // Get code of current Pci IDs subclass object.
00096       subclass_name = "\"" + tmp_sub->get_name() + "\"";    // Get name of current Pci IDs subclass object.
00097 
00098       // Call the stored procedure to add or update the given subclass of the class.
00099       stmt->execute("CALL sp_pciSubClassesAdd("+ class_code + "," + subclass_code + "," + subclass_name + ")");
00100       throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00101 
00102 
00103       if( (tmp_sub->progif_list).size() == 0  ){            // If current Pci IDs subclass has no progif entry,
00104         
00105         prog_code =  "null" ;                               // for the currently stored subclass,
00106         prog_name =  "null" ;                               // put an entry in `pci_prog_ifs' with
00107                                                             // progifCode and progifName values being null.
00108         stmt->execute("CALL sp_pciProgifsAdd("
00109                       + class_code + "," + subclass_code + "," + prog_code +  "," + prog_name + ")");
00110         throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00111 
00112         continue;                                           // Continue to look for other subclasses of the class.
00113       }
00114 
00115       // When the current Pci IDs subclass, has progif entries,
00116       // iterate through the progif list of the subclass      
00117       for( iter_prog = (tmp_sub->progif_list).begin(); iter_prog != (tmp_sub->progif_list).end(); ++iter_prog ){
00118         
00119           tmp_prog = *iter_prog;
00120           prog_code =  "\"" + tmp_prog->get_code() + "\"" ; // Get code of current Pci IDs progif object.
00121           prog_name =  "\"" + tmp_prog->get_name() + "\"" ; // Get name of current Pci IDs progif object.
00122 
00123           // Call the stored procedure to add or update the given progif of the subclass.         
00124           stmt->execute("CALL sp_pciProgifsAdd("
00125                         + class_code + "," + subclass_code + "," + prog_code +  "," + prog_name +")");
00126           throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00127 
00128         }
00129     }
00130   }
00131   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00132     /*
00133       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00134       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00135       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00136       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00137     */
00138     std::cout << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00139     std::cout << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__ << std::endl;
00140     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00141     std::cout << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00142     std::cout << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00143     std::cout << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )" << std::endl;
00144 
00145     return 1;
00146   }
00147 
00148   return 0;
00149 }
00150

00155 
00161 static void throw_call_garbage(sql::Statement* normal_stmt)
00162 {
00163   std::auto_ptr< sql::ResultSet > res;
00164   do {
00165     res.reset(normal_stmt->getResultSet());     // Get result set of the statement,
00166     while (res->next()) {                       // and process until there are no more values left.
00167 #ifdef DEBUG
00168       std::cout << res->getInt(1) << " -> expected value is 0" << std::endl;
00169 #endif
00170     }
00171   } while (normal_stmt->getMoreResults());      // continue if more ResultSets exists, which is not really likely
00172 }

00176 
00177 PciIdsClass::~PciIdsClass()
00178 {
00179   int subclass_list_size = kid_list.size();
00180 
00181   // Loop through the Subclasses(kid_list) of current Class and delete them.  
00182   for ( int k=0; k<subclass_list_size; k++ ){
00183     
00184     delete kid_list.back();     // Since we store pointers in kid_list,
00185                                 // at first we delete the data pointed by the pointer.
00186 
00187     kid_list.pop_back();        // Then we remove the pointer from kid_list.
00188   }
00189 
00190 }
00191 
00192 
00193 
00194 
00195 PciIdsSubclass::~PciIdsSubclass()
00196 {
00197   int progif_list_size = progif_list.size();
00198 
00199   // Loop through the Prog-ifs(progif_list) of current Subclass and delete them.      
00200   for (int k=0; k < progif_list_size; k++){
00201     
00202     delete progif_list.back();  // Since we store pointers in progif_list,
00203                                 // at first we delete the data pointed by the pointer.
00204     
00205     progif_list.pop_back();     // Then we remove the pointer from progif_list.
00206   }
00207 }
